text: you can create a landing page that doesn't check cookies and put the contacts information in there and have a referred by/registered by field to make a workflow that can send any follow up emails to either party.

So I'm coming to the form with up to 5 emails.  I tried embed coding 5 of the same form and submitting them.. didn't work as expected. about 1/2 of the forms actually submitted, but the javascript put them into the forms. I'm wondering if I need to do 5 different forms or put some sort of delay in there
couldn't you submit via the forms api and create your own form with the different people that are being registered that submits the data individually in a hidden iframe
I think that is what I have to do, but that isn't in the budget. I scoped this as a simple workflow once I had the data in the form.  Going to have to eat it it seems like

<@U25PYL3Q8> if you use Zapier, I've done something similar before with a workflow to shoot a webook. HS sends the form fill data to Zapier, I do a little processing, then create a new record (or update if the email is existing in the database) automatically. I haven't ever done it with multiple referrals in a single form though.
thanks <@U26BLKGE4> I appreciate it. I don't use zapier but this is good to keep in mind the next time
So it was only submitting the last form -- so I ended up doing a setTimeout of 500 seconds for each form submission and now it magically works
thanks for all the information/help guys! I appreciate it
has anyone had to deal with creating a workaround for using the calendar field to capture birthdays?
The current calendar option for custom fields does not allow to type a date so prospects would have to scroll from the current year all the way to their year of birth
you could do two select fields that do month and date
and a text field for year
and then push it to the calendar field using javascript
that's a really interesting way...I'll need to play around with it...thanks!

does anyone know if there is any HubL code (or even a module) that would allow someone to choose a link from the pages on the site? For example, I created a custom module that give the ability for a person to put in an item heading for a product list, we want them to be able to not only enter the name for the product but also choose a place to link it to. Right now we simply have a text field there for them to enter a link.
<@U2H3TT8F2|ajlaporte> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/ajlaporte/F39GCKP8B/pasted_image_at_2016_12_01_04_15_pm.png|Pasted image at 2016-12-01, 4:15 PM>
would like for them to ideally be able to use this modal
<@U2H3TT8F2|ajlaporte> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/ajlaporte/F3A8U5TFG/pasted_image_at_2016_12_01_04_16_pm.png|Pasted image at 2016-12-01, 4:16 PM>
currently, no, but there are lots of interesting changes to custom modules in the works
You can create a select/option module, Manually creating the page names and the urls into it.  We have done something like this in the past for selecting CTAs.... <@U2H3TT8F2>
Each time you add a page, you would need to update the module if you want that page selected.
Or, you could probably use the hubl db to manage that if you wanted to.
Our client has alot of pages, thats a good idea though <@U25PYL3Q8>. Thanks, I'll bounce it around others in the office and see if we go that route.
<@U22PJPGK0> is there any sneak peek or a trello of the upcoming changes? I'm looking forward to be able to do more with custom modules.
not yet
